message.content:
cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SI 

The paper focuses on developing a recommendation system framework that considers individual users' differences in their appetite for novelty and diversity, which is a key aspect of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses evaluation metrics for recommender systems, such as novelty and coverage, which are related to information retrieval (cs.IR). The proposed model and framework involve machine learning techniques, which fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the psychological concept of the Wundt curve, which is related to cognitive science (cs.CY) and the proposed framework aims to promote intrinsic interest with the system, which is related to social and information networks (cs.SI).
